business.headline: High-end electric vehicles likely to attract 18% GSTAccording to the proposals, GST on four-wheeled EVs priced between Rs 20 lakh and Rs 40 lakh will be raised from 5 per cent to 18 per cent.
Chocolates with cocoa, pastries, ice cream likely to be taxed at 5% instead of 18%The proposed rationalisation stems from the Council's broader push to simplify the GST framework.

Condensed milk, dates, jams, mushrooms, namkeens to get cheaper under GST 2.0The fitment committee has proposed that products such as butter, condensed milk, jams, mushrooms, dates, nuts, and namkeens move from the current 12 per cent GST slab to just 5 per cent.

PM SVANidhi scheme extended till 2030, higher loans and credit cards for vendorsThe move is expected to benefit 1.15 crore street vendors, including 50 lakh new beneficiaries. The scheme will continue to be implemented jointly by the Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs (MoHUA) and the Department of Financial Services (DFS).

India eyes new markets amid US tariffs, aims to boost textile, jewellery exportsPlans are being drawn up to explore new markets, increase outreach, and give special attention to sectors such as textiles and gems and jewellery, which are likely to be among the hardest hit by the tariff.
Can a Rs 10,000 monthly SIP make you a crorepati? Here's the timelineCan Rs 10,000 a month really make you a crorepati? The maths of SIPs shows that with discipline and time, the answer is yes.

These 3 banks offer special FDs with higher interest rates till September 2025For those planning to invest in FDs, three banks are running special schemes with better interest rates valid up to September 2025.

How will Trump's 50% tariff impact India's growthThe 50% tariff by the US comes at a time when India has reported strong growth of 6.5% in 2024–25 and has been projected to remain the fastest-growing major economy.

Filing ITR for FY 2024-25? Keep these 6 documents handyKeeping your documents in order is the first step to a smooth filing process. Not having the documents in place not only delays the process but also increases the chance of errors in the return.

Indian crypto platforms boom in grey zone, says Zerodha's Nithin KamathTraders are increasingly drawn to futures and options (F&O) products in digital assets, lured by high leverage and lower tax costs compared to traditional markets.

Trump's 50% tariff shock: How can exporters shield themselvesThe tariff was announced as a response to India's continued trade with Russia, and it now places Indian products at a disadvantage in the American market.

New to ITR filing? Here's how to create your account on the e-filing portalNew taxpayers often wonder how to start their ITR journey, and the answer is simple: create your account on the e-filing portal to access all tax-related services.

Indian leather industry eyes expansion in Russian, African markets amid US tariffsTrade delegations are set to visit Russia and Africa soon, with Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expected to lead the mission in Russia. Buyer-seller meets are also planned in African countries.

Ganesh Chaturthi 2025: Is stock market open for trading today?The stock market holiday list for 2025 is available on the official BSE (Bombay Stock Exchange) website. Earlier, markets were closed on August 15 for Independence Day.
How will Trump's 50% tariff impact Indian economy and its exports?The United States has escalated its trade dispute with India, imposing new tariffs that bring the total rate to 50% on certain goods.

How will Trump's 50% tariff impact Indian economy? Experts weigh inThe discussion centres on the implications of a 50% tariff threatened by Donald Trump on Indian goods. Experts analyse the potential impact on India's economy, particularly labour-intensive sectors such as textiles, leather, gems and jewellery.

Papa John's to return to India with Bengaluru outlet, plans 650 stores by 2035US-based Papa John's will re-enter India this October, opening its first store in Bengaluru and targeting 650 outlets by 2035. The pizza chain, which exited in 2017 due to poor performance, has partnered with Pulsar Capital and UAE's PJP Investments Group as master franchisees.

TCS appoints Amit Kapur to lead new AI and services transformation unitIn a bid to deepen its AI capabilities, TCS has named Amit Kapur as the head of its newly formed AI and services transformation unit, effective September.

No credit history? How lenders are opening doors for new borrowersFor decades, a blank credit history meant a closed door to loans. Now, fintechs and banks are rewriting the rules—using digital footprints and alternative data to bring first-time borrowers into the fold.

PM holds high-level meet on US tariff impact, explores relief for exportersThe PMO on Tuesday held a high-level meeting with senior ministers and officials from the Finance and Commerce Ministries to frame India's response to the US decision to double tariffs on Indian goods to 50% from Wednesday.

New Income Tax Act's password override: Privacy threat or necessary power?India's new tax law brings a digital twist; officials can now override passwords during raids. Supporters say it's just enforcement in the digital age, but privacy advocates worry about unchecked surveillance.
Sensex slumps 849 points, Nifty below 24,750; Tata Steel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 849.37 points to close at 80,786.54, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 255.70 points to end at 24,712.05.

Woman got tax notice of Rs 2.58 crore. Here's how she reduced it to Rs 0Seema found herself staring at a tax notice of Rs 2.58 crore after selling a piece of land in Patna. The confusion arose due to a simple error in her tax return.

Trump's 50% tariff takes effect tomorrow: Who wins, who losesThe United States government has issued a draft notification confirming the step, which will be applied through a supplementary 25% duty on top of existing tariffs.

What India really needs to become 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047IndiaToday.in reached out to leading economists to understand what India must do over the next two decades to achieve its 'Viksit Bharat' vision. Here's what they had to say.
HDFC Bank share crash explained: Did it actually fall over 50%?HDFC Bank's shares appeared to have tanked over 50% compared to the previous close on Dalal Street in early trade.

Switching from UPS to NPS? Here's what employees must knowCentral government employees now have a one-time chance to switch from the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS) to the National Pension System (NPS). But the move comes with strict rules, deadlines, and conditions.

Simplified, new tax rules and forms: What you need to knowThe Income Tax department is working on new rules and forms under the Income-tax Act, 2025, which will be notified by December-end to ensure a smoother, simpler process for taxpayers.

Once 'white gold', cotton turns into burden for India's farmersAt present, cotton cultivation area, production, and productivity are all going down. In just two years, the cotton cultivation area has fallen by 14.8 lakh hectares, while production has dropped by 42.35 lakh bales.

Sensex crashes 900 points: Why is stock market down today?The BSE Sensex showed a negative start as trading commenced today, with most stocks tanking at the opening bell. Sensex and Nifty fell nearly 1% a few minutes after opening for trading.

Sensex, Nifty tank nearly 1% as US tariff fears spook D-Street investorsThe Sensex fell over 500 points, while the Nifty slipped below the psychological 24,900 mark in early trade, mirroring global risk-off cues.

What is the 10-30-50 formula? Edelweiss MF's Radhika Gupta on smart money habitsRadhika Gupta explained that this tug of war between splurging and saving is not new. In fact, she advised a simple rule for different life stages, i.e., the 10-30-50 principle.

Fitch retains its rating for India, sees growth at 6.5%Fitch's rating comes days after S&P Global Ratings lifted its sovereign credit rating on India, citing strong economic growth, marking its first upgrade in 18 years.
Sensex ends 329 points higher, Nifty above 24.950; Infosys gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 329.06 points to close at 81,635.91, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 97.65 points to end at 24,967.75.

Are wedding gifts really tax-free? Here's the answerIn India, weddings are full of joy, rituals and generous gifts. But when the celebrations end, many couples wonder, do these gifts come with hidden tax bills? The answer may surprise you.

PMO to convene big meeting tomorrow as US tariffs set to come into force: SourcesThe Prime Minister's Office will hold a high-level review meeting on August 26 to assess support measures for Indian exporters hit by higher US tariffs. The session, chaired by the PM's Principal Secretary, comes as Washington doubles duties, with Indian goods now facing a steep 50% tariff, raising cost pressures on exporters.

Why hospitals have barred cashless services from Bajaj Allianz policyholdersThe meeting between AHPI's (Association of Healthcare Providers India) will include core committee members and senior representatives from Bajaj Allianz, and is scheduled for August 28.
Zerodha's Nithin Kamath on the one skill AI can't replaceNithin Kamath explained that curiosity should not be confined to a person's own role but should extend to the larger environment around them.

Big PMO meet tomorrow as Trump's 50% tariffs set to come into force: SourcesStarting Wednesday, Indian goods entering the US market will be subject to a 50% tariff after Washington doubled existing duties, heightening cost pressures on exporters.

Common empanelment explained: Why big private hospitals and insurers are at oddsCommon empanelment aims to simplify cashless insurance in India, but hospitals resist over tariffs and operational issues, leaving policyholders' access dependent on achieving fair rates, efficient settlements, and system flexibility.

entertainment.headline: MrBeast slammed for mocking Rolling Stone list after Caleb Hearon outranks himMrBeast faced backlash after mocking Rolling Stone's creator rankings, where Caleb Hearon ranked higher. Critics said he reduced influence to follower counts, while fans defended his unmatched reach.

Ekta Kapoor cautions actors against fake audition calls for Balaji TelefilmsProducer Ekta Kapoor issued an official statement through the social media handle of Balaji Telefilms warning actors against fraudulent casting directors impersonating their staff. The alert aims to protect aspiring actors from scams and misuse of the company's name.

Harry Potter shops with Hagrid at Diagon Alley and more in new pics from HBO showThe pictures from the new 'Harry Potter' series surfaced on the internet. The upcoming show is based on the original book while also introducing new elements like the full Weasley family.

Google marks Taylor and Travis's engagement with golden hearts and diamondsTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce are engaged! Google celebrates the couple's big news with golden hearts and diamonds in search results.

Allu Arjun, Ram Charan to Mohanlal: South stars share Ganesh Chaturthi wishesSeveral South Indian stars, including Mohanlal, Allu Arjun, Ram Charan, Shiva Rajkumar, Chiranjeevi, and Sivakarthikeyan, took to social media to extend Ganesh Chaturthi greetings to their fans.

Tamil actor Lakshmi Menon named in kidnapping, assault case of IT professionalTamil actor Lakshmi Menon has been named as an accused in a kidnapping and assault case in Kochi. The incident has sparked controversy after visuals of the argument went viral and arrests were made.

Aishwarya Sharma celebrates Ganpati without Neil Bhatt, reignites separation rumoursTelevision actor Aishwarya Sharma celebrated Ganesh Chaturthi without her actor husband Neil Bhatt, fueling speculation about a possible separation. The couple fell in love on the sets of 'Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin' and married in 2021.

Amaal Mallik makes a cute confession about Shraddha Kapoor on Bigg Boss 19. WatchSinger Amaal Mallik made a confession about actor Shraddha Kapoor in 'Bigg Boss 19'. The clip is now going viral on social media and winning hearts. Mallik praised the actor's simplicity and charm and also talked about her Instagram popularity.

Govinda's wife Sunita breaks silence on divorce reports: Even God can't separate usSunita Ahuja denies rumours of divorce from actor Govinda. She emphasises their strong bond and urges privacy amid speculation.

13 times Taylor Swift manifested her engagement in songs - so high school, but trueDiscover 13 Taylor Swift songs where she quietly manifested her engagement, from 'Love Story' to 'Lover' and beyond. Swifties saw it coming all along.

Govinda, Sunita Ahuja's Ganesh Chaturthi celebration puts divorce rumours to restBollywood actor Govinda and his wife Sunita Ahuja put divorce rumours to rest as they welcomed Lord Ganpati on Wednesday. Dressed in coordinated outfits, the couple posed for paparazzi and celebrated the occasion with their son Yashvardhan.

Farhan Akhtar on playing Major Shaitan in 120 Bahadur: Rezang La heroes inspired me Actor Farhan Akhtar unveiled the teaser of '120 Bahadur', where he plays Param Vir Chakra awardee Major Shaitan Singh Bhati, honouring the bravery of 120 soldiers in the 1962 Battle of Rezang La. He said the story inspired him deeply, calling it a timeless tale of patriotism and determination.

KBC 17: Bihar contestant breaks down before Big B, recalls family strugglesIn the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', a contestant from Bihar broke down in front of host Amitabh Bachchan. The contestant recalled his family struggles and spoke about the loss of his parents.

Singer Lil Nas X's 1st statement on arrest over cop assault, walking naked chargesSinger Lil Nas X has addressed fans after his arrest in Los Angeles, confirming he is safe. The rapper faces serious felony charges amid disputes over alleged drug use.

Malayalam actor Rajesh Keshav on ventilator support after cardiac arrest in KochiVeteran Malayalam anchor and actor Rajesh Keshav is on ventilator support after suffering a cardiac arrest during a live event in Kochi. Doctors performed an emergency angioplasty, but his condition remains critical with suspected mild brain damage.

Singer Suchitra accuses fiance of abuse: He kicked me, usurped my home, moneySinger Suchitra, in an Instagram video, claimed that she was duped by her lawyer, fiance Shunmugaraj. She claimed to have faced domestic abuse and accused him of usurping her Chennai home.

Pooja Bhatt slams Mumbai's pothole-ridden roads, calls out civic apathyPooja Bhatt criticised the worsening state of Mumbai's roads, especially in Bandra, slamming civic apathy and questioning prolonged repair work that has left potholes untouched.

Half CA 2 Review: Ahsaas's show captures exam stress but misses fresh sparkRelease Date:Wed Aug 27, 2025Half CA 2 review: Ahsaas Channa's series returns with strong performances and heartfelt moments, though its familiar plot makes it a predictable watch.

Neha Dhupia-Angad Bedi go on their first honeymoon after 8 years of marriage. PicsNeha Dhupia and Angad Bedi finally went on their first honeymoon after eight years of marriage, celebrating her birthday with a Mediterranean getaway. The actor shared stunning photos from the trip, calling it a celebration of love, family, and new beginnings.

general news.headline: This is Modi's war: Trump aide Peter Navarro's bizarre logic on Ukraine conflictWhite House adviser Peter Navarro alleged that India's continued purchase of Russian oil is fuelling Moscow's aggression and burdening US taxpayers. He said India could get a 25% reduction in US tariffs if it stops buying Russian oil.

Trump singling out India, China buys more Russian oil: Democrats slam tariffsThe criticism came a day after Donald Trump's revised tariff policy on India came into effect. The president had initially announced 25 per cent "reciprocal tariffs" on Indian goods but later doubled the figure to 50 per cent, calling it a penalty for New Delhi's continued oil imports from Russia.

Trade now weaponised: Raghuram Rajan calls US tariffs a wake-up call for IndiaAfter a staggering 50 per cent US tariffs took effect on many Indian products, ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan remarked that trade has been increasingly weaponised in today's global order, and that India should tread carefully.

Minneapolis shooter scrawled 'Nuke India', 'Mashallah' on guns used in attackThe Minneapolis school shooting left two children dead and 17 injured, with authorities confirming the gunman's weapons carried antisemitic, anti-India and anti-Israel slogans.

How India sprung back after US sanctions 27 years agoFrom economic sanctions to reciprocal tariffs, the US has many a time tried to pressurise India through aid cuts, blocking international loans, and bans on technology transfers. Yet, deft Indian diplomacy and indigenous growth not only ensured the rollback of these punitive actions but also resulted in stronger bilateral ties. Here's how India, over 25 years ago, shrugged off American sanctions and emerged stronger.

Republican candidate vows to 'end Islam in Texas,' burns Quran in campaign videoValentina Gomez has sparked outrage after posting a now-deleted video on X in which she burned a Quran. The Republican hopeful, running for the 31st Congressional District in 2026, has a history of incendiary stunts and extremist rhetoric.
Two terrorists killed as Indian Army foils infiltration bid in J&K, search op onThe Indian Army foiled an infiltration attempt along the Line of Control in the Gurez sector of Jammu and Kashmir.

From makhana fields to missing votes, Rahul Gandhi's discovery of BiharRahul Gandhi's Voter Adhikar Yatra is perhaps the most sustained effort by the Congress in decades to touch the lived anxieties of Bihar and regain electoral relevance in the state

US visa proposal: 4-year student visas, 240-day limit for foreign journalistsThe Trump administration has proposed fixed visa terms for students, cultural exchange visitors, and foreign journalists, replacing open-ended stays with strict limits to increase oversight, reviving a measure first introduced in 2020.

Maharashtra couple celebrates daughter's 1st birthday. Then, building collapsesThe child, Utkarsha Joyal, and her 24-year-old mother, Aarohi Joyal, died in the incident, while her father, Omkar Joyal, remains missing as rescue operations continue.

Nikki's death and social media: Dowry flaunted in reels, brides bear the bruntWhat was once whispered as 'dahej' (dowry) is now flaunted online for all to see. The law calls dowry a crime. Yet in many homes, it is still wrapped as 'riwaz' (tradition), and on Instagram reels, it often goes viral as a display of status.

Impact of tariffs not as exaggerated, exports not dependent on US alone: SourcesThere are "no panic or large distress signals at all" from Indian exporters in the wake of the US tariffs, government sources said, adding that exports are "not dependent on the US alone".

Daniil Medvedev handed USD 42,500 fine for dramatic US Open meltdownDaniil Medvedev's turbulent 2025 season hit a low at the US Open, where a first-round loss to Benjamin Bonzi and a furious outburst cost him a hefty fine. The setback capped a miserable Grand Slam year, with the Russian advancing past the opening round only once all season.

If Indians don't budge, Trump won't, US adviser Hassett warns as tariffs hit 50%Speaking to reporters at the White House, Kevin Hassett accused India of "intransigence" in opening its markets to American products and suggested President Trump could harden his approach further if New Delhi refuses to yield ground.

The alert aims to protect aspiring actors from scams and misuse of the company's name.

I think we'll come together with India, says Trump aide as 50% tariffs kick inAs the US's 50 per cent tariffs on Indian goods kicked in starting today, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent described the bilateral ties as "complicated", but stressed the two countries would come together "at the end of the day".

36 dead as rain pounds J&K, Jhelum over danger mark, landslide hits Vaishno Devi YatraA landslide triggered by heavy rain claimed 36 lives and left several others injured along the Vaishno Devi Yatra route in Jammu and Kashmir's Katra. The torrential rain has triggered widespread disruption across the Union Territory.

From nurse to India's first woman Major-General: How Gertrude Alice Ram made historyOn August 27, 1976, Gertrude Alice Ram made history as the first woman in the Indian Army to become a Major-General. Her leadership in military nursing broke the glass ceiling an d opened doors for women across the defence forces.

62% of Americans want tougher sanctions on nations trading with Russia: PollRussia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022 unleashed the deadliest conflict in Europe since World War II. According to reports, more than a million people have been killed or wounded, including thousands of Ukrainian civilians caught in the fighting.

Man sexually assaults stepdaughter for years, mother stays silent, both convictedA Manipur fast-track court convicted a stepfather for repeatedly sexually assaulting his minor stepdaughter and the mother for staying silent, while acquitting a co-accused for lack of evidence. Sentencing will be decided in upcoming sessions.

sports.headline: Carlos Alcaraz crushes Mattia Bellucci, Casper Ruud stunned by World No.107Carlos Alcaraz powered past Italy's Mattia Bellucci 6-1, 6-0, 6-3 to reach the US Open third round while Casper Ruud slumped to a defeat at the hands of World No.107 Raphael Collignon.

No world record, but Armand Duplantis wins 5th straight Diamond League titleArmand Duplantis won the men's pole vault at the Diamond League final in Zurich, clearing 6.00m before falling short of the meet record. The Swede now owns five Diamond League titles, just two shy of the all-time record.

US Open: Novak Djokovic rolls into Round 3, equals Roger Federer's recordNovak Djokovic secured a second-round win over Zachary Svadja in the US Open men's singles competition. He will now be up against the winner between Cameron Norrie and Francisco Comesana.

Emma Raducanu into third round after 4 years, 5th seed Draper withdrawsEmma Raducanu stormed into the US Open third round with a 6-2, 6-1 win over Janice Tjen — her first deep run in New York since her 2021 title. The Brit hit 16 winners and 8 aces, while fellow Brit Jack Draper pulled out of the men's draw with injury.

After IPL retirement, R Ashwin keen to play in The Hundred: ReportAfter retiring from the IPL, Ravichandran Ashwin is eyeing overseas leagues, with reports linking him to The Hundred in 2026. The spin legend could boost the tournament's profile, though his participation is yet to be confirmed.

Pardeep Narwal's legacy to be honoured by PKL ahead of Season 12 openerThe Pro Kabbaddi League will honour the legacy of Pardeep Narwal ahead of the season 12 opener on August 29. Pardeep retired from kabaddi in June of this year after not getting picked up by any team during the auction.

CSK pays heartfelt tribute to 'thirupurra sundaran' R Ashwin after IPL retirementR Ashwin announced his retirement from the Indian Premier League, ending an illustrious stint with Chennai Super Kings. The five-time champions paid a rich tribute to the off-spinner.

Ashwin retires from IPL: Top moments of spin great's Indian Premier League careerRavichandran Ashwin bid farewell to the Indian Premier League after an illustrious career spanning 221 matches and 187 wickets. R Ashwin retires from IPL amid trade rumours, sets sight on overseas leaguesIndia spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from the Indian Premier League on Wednesday, August 27. Ashwin announced his retirement via a post on his social media accounts.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
